00013 #include "host.h"

00015 
00321 #if defined(VL_ARCH_IX86) || defined(VL_ARCH_IA64) || defined(VL_ARCH_X64)
00322 #define HAS_CPUID
00323 #endif
00324 
00325 #if defined(HAS_CPUID) & defined(VL_COMPILER_MSC)
00326 #include <intrin.h>
00327 VL_INLINE void
00328 _vl_cpuid (vl_int32* info, int function)
00329 {
00330   __cpuid(info, function) ;
00331 }
00332 #endif
00333 
00334 #if defined(HAS_CPUID) & defined(VL_COMPILER_GNUC)
00335 VL_INLINE void
00336 _vl_cpuid (vl_int32* info, int function)
00337 {
00338 #if defined(VL_ARCH_IX86) && (defined(__PIC__) || defined(__pic__))
00339   /* This version is compatible with -fPIC on x386 targets. This special
00340    * case is required becaus
00341    * on such platform -fPIC alocates ebx as global offset table pointer.
00342    * Note that =r below will be mapped to a register different from ebx,
00343    * so the code is sound. */
00344   __asm__ __volatile__
00345   ("pushl %%ebx      \n" /* save %ebx */
00346    "cpuid            \n"
00347    "movl %%ebx, %1   \n" /* save what cpuid just put in %ebx */
00348    "popl %%ebx       \n" /* restore the old %ebx */
00349    : "=a"(info[0]), "=r"(info[1]), "=c"(info[2]), "=d"(info[3])
00350    : "a"(function)
00351    : "cc") ; /* clobbered (cc=condition codes) */
00352 #else /* no -fPIC or -fPIC with a 64-bit target */
00353   __asm__ __volatile__
00354   ("cpuid"
00355    : "=a"(info[0]), "=b"(info[1]), "=c"(info[2]), "=d"(info[3])
00356    : "a"(function)
00357    : "cc") ;
00358 #endif
00359 }
00360 #endif
00361 
00362 #ifdef HAS_CPUID
00363 struct x86cpu_
00364 {
00365   char vendor_string [0x20] ;
00366   vl_bool has_sse42 ;
00367   vl_bool has_sse41 ;
00368   vl_bool has_sse3 ;
00369   vl_bool has_sse2 ;
00370   vl_bool has_sse ;
00371   vl_bool has_mmx ;
00372 } x86cpu ;
00373 
00374 vl_bool x86cpu_initialized = 0 ;
00375 
00376 void _vl_x86cpu_init ()
00377 {
00378   vl_int32 info [4] ;
00379   int max_func = 0 ;
00380   _vl_cpuid(info, 0) ;
00381   max_func = info[0] ;
00382   *((vl_int32*)x86cpu.vendor_string+0) = info[1] ;
00383   *((vl_int32*)x86cpu.vendor_string+1) = info[3] ;
00384   *((vl_int32*)x86cpu.vendor_string+2) = info[2] ;
00385 
00386   if (max_func >= 1) {
00387     _vl_cpuid(info, 1) ;
00388     x86cpu.has_mmx   = info[3] & (1 << 23) ;
00389     x86cpu.has_sse   = info[3] & (1 << 25) ;
00390     x86cpu.has_sse2  = info[3] & (1 << 26) ;
00391     x86cpu.has_sse3  = info[2] & (1 <<  0) ;
00392     x86cpu.has_sse41 = info[2] & (1 << 19) ;
00393     x86cpu.has_sse42 = info[2] & (1 << 20) ;
00394   }
00395 }
00396 
00397 VL_INLINE
00398 struct x86cpu_ const* _vl_x86cpu_get()
00399 {
00400   if (!x86cpu_initialized) _vl_x86cpu_init() ;
00401   return &x86cpu ;
00402 }
00403 #endif
00404 
00407 vl_bool simd_enabled = 1 ;
00408 
00417 void vl_set_simd_enabled (vl_bool x)
00418 {
00419   simd_enabled = x ;
00420 }
00421 
00425 vl_bool vl_get_simd_enabled ()
00426 {
00427   return simd_enabled ;
00428 }
00429 
00433 vl_bool vl_cpu_has_sse3 ()
00434 {
00435 #ifdef HAS_CPUID
00436   return _vl_x86cpu_get()->has_sse3 ;
00437 #else
00438   return 0 ;
00439 #endif
00440 }
00441 
00445 vl_bool vl_cpu_has_sse2 ()
00446 {
00447 #ifdef HAS_CPUID
00448   return _vl_x86cpu_get()->has_sse2 ;
00449 #else
00450   return 0 ;
00451 #endif
00452 }
00453 
00458 void vl_print_host_info ()
00459 {
00460   char const *arch = 0, *endian = 0, *comp = 0, *dm = 0 ;
00461   int compver ;
00462 #ifdef VL_ARCH_X64
00463   arch = "X64" ;
00464 #endif
00465 #ifdef VL_ARCH_IA64
00466   arch = "IA64" ;
00467 #endif
00468 #ifdef VL_ARCH_IX86
00469   arch = "IX86" ;
00470 #endif
00471 #ifdef VL_ARCH_PPC
00472   arch = "PPC" ;
00473 #endif
00474 
00475 #ifdef VL_ARCH_BIN_ENDIAN
00476   endian = "big endian" ;
00477 #endif
00478 #ifdef VL_ARCH_LITTLE_ENDIAN
00479   endian = "little endian" ;
00480 #endif
00481 
00482 #ifdef VL_COMPILER_MSC
00483   comp = "Microsoft Visual C++" ;
00484   compver = VL_COMPILER_MSC ;
00485 #endif
00486 #ifdef VL_COMPILER_GNUC
00487   comp = "GNU C" ;
00488   compver = VL_COMPILER_GNUC ;
00489 #endif
00490 
00491 #ifdef VL_COMPILER_LP64
00492   dm = "LP64" ;
00493 #endif
00494 #ifdef VL_COMPILER_LLP64
00495   dm = "LP64" ;
00496 #endif
00497 #ifdef VL_COMPILER_ILP32
00498   dm = "ILP32" ;
00499 #endif
00500 
00501 #define YESNO(x) ((x)?"yes":"no")
00502 
00503   VL_PRINTF("Host: Compiler: %s %d\n", comp, compver) ;
00504   VL_PRINTF("      Compiler data model: %s\n", dm) ;
00505   VL_PRINTF("      Compiler CPU architecture: %s\n", arch) ;
00506   VL_PRINTF("      Compiler CPU endianness: %s\n", endian) ;
00507 
00508 #ifdef HAS_CPUID
00509   {
00510     struct x86cpu_ const* c = _vl_x86cpu_get() ;
00511     VL_PRINTF("      CPU vendor string: %s\n", c->vendor_string) ;
00512     VL_PRINTF("      CPU has MMX: %s\n",    YESNO(c->has_mmx)) ;
00513     VL_PRINTF("      CPU has SSE: %s\n",    YESNO(c->has_sse)) ;
00514     VL_PRINTF("      CPU has SSE2: %s\n",   YESNO(c->has_sse2)) ;
00515     VL_PRINTF("      CPU has SSE3: %s\n",   YESNO(c->has_sse3)) ;
00516     VL_PRINTF("      CPU has SSE4.1: %s\n", YESNO(c->has_sse41)) ;
00517     VL_PRINTF("      CPU has SSE4.2: %s\n", YESNO(c->has_sse42)) ;
00518     VL_PRINTF("VLFeat uses SIMD: %s\n", YESNO(vl_get_simd_enabled())) ;
00519   }
00520 #endif
00521 }
